text:
When a downloading of static file was aborted in browser side, I found that in 
afterBody(Request, Response) of one of the RequestInterceptor the the 
response.getStatus() method returns different value in Linux and Win2000.

In Linux, the value is 200, however, in Win2000 is 500.  use the value to keep 
track of the number of successful file downloading.

I'm using Win2000 now. I would like to switch to Linux platform. However, same 
price of code behave differently in Linux. 

See below for the output printed in Win2000 and Linux.

I use the following program in both Linux and Win2000 platform
Apache 1.3.19
Tomcat 3.1.2
mod_jk


Below is output found in Win2000
2001-05-21 01:20:17 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx(  )
2001-05-21 01:20:17 - ContextManager: Adding context Ctx( /test )
2001-05-21 01:20:20 - PoolTcpConnector: Starting HttpConnectionHandler on 8080
2001-05-21 01:20:20 - PoolTcpConnector: Starting Ajp12ConnectionHandler on 8007
2001-05-21 01:20:20 - PoolTcpConnector: Starting Ajp13ConnectionHandler on 8009
2001-05-21 01:20:30 - Ctx( /examples ): IOException in: R( /examples + /ajp13/ic
q2000b.exe + null) Connection reset by peer: socket write error
********MyJDBCRealm.afterBody response.getstatus=500******

2001-05-21 01:20:30 - Ctx( /examples ): IOException in: R( /examples + /ajp13/ic
q2000b.exe + null) Connection reset by peer: socket write error
java.net.SocketException: Connection reset by peer: JVM_recv in socket input str
eam read
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:90)
        at org.apache.tomcat.service.connector.TcpConnector.receiveFully(TcpConn
ector.java, Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.tomcat.service.connector.TcpConnector.receive(TcpConnector
.java:121)
        at org.apache.tomcat.service.connector.Ajp13ConnectionHandler.processCon
nection(Ajp13ConnectionHandler.java, Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.tomcat.service.TcpWorkerThread.runIt(PoolTcpEndpoint.java,
 Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.tomcat.util.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java
, Compiled Code)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:479)

cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
I don't think we can fix this for 3.3, but it should be resolved for the first
jakarta-tomcat-connector release.

I am resolving it as LATER for Tomcat 3.2.x and potentially Tomcat 3.3. Please
retest using Tomcat 3.3 and open a new bug if this problem is still present.
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
